summary: This is a scanned U.S. passport application by mail for Ghislaine Noelle Maxwell, dated January 9, 2008. It includes her personal details, travel plans, and a letter of authorization for a passport expediting service. The document is significant as it provides official biographical and contact information for Maxwell during the period of the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Noelle Maxwell
persons.context: The individual applying for a U.S. passport by mail, providing personal details, contact information, and travel plans.

events.title: Passport Application Submission
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell submits a U.S. passport application by mail, authorizing Travisa Passport & Visa Service to handle the submission and delivery.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell applied for a U.S. passport by mail on January 9, 2008.
Her listed permanent address was in New York, NY 10065.
Her stated travel plans included trips to South Africa and Israel for a duration of 4 months.
She authorized a third-party service, Travisa Passport & Visa Service, to submit her application and accept delivery of the passport on her behalf.
The application confirms her place of birth as Maisons Laffitte, France, and her date of birth as December 25, 1961.
